fields.subject: Reporting data on ODS covering {year} activities due by {closing_date}
fields.body_html:
Dear {{CONTACT}},

This message is addressed to you as the contact person of an undertaking that needs to report data on Ozone Depleting Substances (ODS) under Article 27 of Regulation (EC) No 1005/2009.

The report needs to be submitted to the European Environment Agency (EEA) using the online Business Data Repository (BDR) at https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu. In order to submit your report you will need to login using the username and password for your company.

The company for which you have received reporting rights is {{COMPANY}} in {{COUNTRY}}. The username for your company is: {{USERID}} and the password is {{PASSWORD}}.

How to submit your report?

Detailed information on how to upload your delivery to BDR is available at: https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu/help/ods.

Reporting requirements and forms

As for previous years, the EEA is using online webforms to collect the data you need to submit. This allows amongst others the data to be fed directly into a database without the need for manual processing. The webforms can perform certain checks immediately while you are completing the form or immediately after submission. This will increase the user friendliness and reduce the administrative burden for all stakeholders. It will also reduce the number of questions posed to you after submission.

Reporting is not required if you solely import or export products or equipment containing or relying on ODS (e.g. fire extinguishers or aircraft).

BDR Helpdesk

Please feel free to contact the BDR Helpdesk (BDR.helpdesk@eea.europa.eu):

  • if you received this e-mail but you think that you are no longer subject to the reporting obligations, please be so kind to inform us accordingly.
  • for technical assistance with access to BDR and the submission process

Thank you in advance for your co-operation.

Yours faithfully
BDR Helpdesk

fields.subject: Reminder - ODS reporting covering {year} due by {closing_date}
fields.body_html:
Dear {{CONTACT}},

This message is addressed to you as the contact person of an undertaking that by {closing_date} needs to report data on Ozone Depleting Substances (ODS) under Article 27 of Regulation (EC) No 1005/2009.

You receive this message because so far EEA has not received the report for {{COMPANY}} in {{COUNTRY}} with username {{USERID}} before 27/03/2017.

In case you should not have submitted your report we kindly ask you to report to the European Environment Agency (EEA) using the online Business Data Repository (BDR) at: https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu. Further information is available on the BDR website (https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu/help/ods).

Please submit the webform in BDR at your earliest convenience but at the latest by 31/03/2017.

If you received this e-mail but you think that you are no longer subject to the reporting obligations, please be so kind to let us know by filling in a short online reporting form stating that you are not obliged to report for the year 2016 (NIL report). For this purpose, you would need to follow the procedures as described in the ODS BDR user manual (https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu/help/ods).

Disclaimer: The mailing list used for this reminder was last updated 26/03/2017.

Thank you in advance for your co-operation.

Yours faithfully,
BDR Helpdesk

fields.subject: WARNING - ODS reporting covering {year} due by {closing_date}
fields.body_html:
Dear {{CONTACT}},

This message is addressed to you as the contact person of an undertaking that by {closing_date} needs to report data on ozone-depleting substances (ODS) under Article 27 of Regulation (EC) No 1005/2009.

You receive this message because so far EEA has not received the report for {{COMPANY}} in {{COUNTRY}} with username {{USERID}} despite our earlier requests and the fact that the deadline for the submission has passed on {closing_date}.

We urge you to submit the report now without any further delay using the online Business Data Repository (BDR) at https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu. Further information is available on the BDR website (https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu/help/ods). We informed the European Commission about the delay. This might lead to an investigation regarding your potential non-compliance with Article 27 of Regulation (EC) No 1005/2009. This may result into a fine.

In case you should have sent the report already before the evening of 9 April 2017, please contact us at bdr.helpdesk@eea.europa.eu to verify whether or not the report was actually received.

If you received this e-mail but you think that you are no longer subject to the reporting obligations, please be so kind to let us know by filling in a short online reporting form stating that you are not obliged to report for the year 2016 (NIL report). For this purpose, you will need to follow the procedures as described in the ODS BDR user manual (https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu/help/ods). bdr.helpdesk@eea.europa.eu.

Disclaimer: The mailing list used for this reminder was last updated 9 April end of business.

Thank you in advance for your co-operation.

Yours faithfully,
BDR Helpdesk

fields.subject: Reporting data on F-Gases covering {year} activities due by {closing_date}
fields.body_html:
Dear {{CONTACT}},

This message is addressed to you as the contact person of an undertaking that by {closing_date} may need to report data on fluorinated greenhouse gases (F-Gases) under Article 19 of Regulation (EU) No 517/2014.

You receive this invitation as your company is registered in the European Commission's F-gas Portal https://webgate.ec.europa.eu/ods2/ and your business profile as stated therein implies that you need to report.

The company for which you have received reporting rights is {{COMPANY}} ({{VAT}}) in {{COUNTRY}}. Please note that this message is addressed to all contact persons that are registered for this company.

How to submit your report?

For reporting please use your EU login account and password, which allows you to access the F-gas portal. You access the reporting platform either from within the F-gas portal by clicking on the orange "Reporting" link (top right corner) or by proceeding directly to the online Business Data Repository (BDR) at: https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu.

Detailed information on how to upload your delivery to BDR is available in the BDR user manual: https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu/help/fgases.

The BDR is now open for reporting on 2016 activties!

Reporting requirements

Reporting is obligatory for each

  • Producer, importer and exporter that produced, imported or exported one metric tonne or 100 tonnes of CO2 equivalent or more of F-gases (Annex I and/or Annex II). The reportable quantity of F-gases imported or exported covers bulk shipments, including F-gases shipped with equipment for the purpose of charging that equipment. Please note that imports and exports refer to imports into the EU and exports out of the EU. Shipments between EU Member States are not considered imports or exports and are thus not subject to reporting.
  • Company that destroyed 1 metric tonne or 1 000 tonnes of CO2 equivalent or more of F-gases.
  • Company that used 1 000 tonnes of CO2 equivalent or more of F-gases as feedstock.
  • Company that placed on the EU market 500 tonnes of CO2 equivalent or more of F-gases contained in imported products or equipment.
  • Company that authorised the use of HFC quota to another undertaking.

Please note that since 2015 the list of reportable F-gases was extended compared to previous years. Along with other technical guidance on how to understand the reporting obligation the reportable gases are listed in the updated Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) document available on: https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu/help/fgases. Translations of the FAQ in French, German, Italian, Polish and Spanish should be available by early March.

In case you did already submit a report in previous years; you may save time by using a prefilled webform. This includes the structural information from your latest submission of last year such as:

  • Company affiliations,
  • Selected activities,
  • Selected gases,
  • Trade partners,
  • Selected categories for imported products and equipment.

Please note that you still are able to change the previously reported information. Numeric information on reported amounts of gases will not be taken over from the past reports.

For producers and importers, the 31 December stocks as reported for the previous year will be imported as 01 January stocks for the present year. In case you make changes to the 01 January stocks, please provide a comment in order to explain the deviation in stocks with the 31 December stocks of the previous year. For more detailed information and guidance please consult the recently updated F-gas BDR User Manual available at: https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu/help/fgases.

If you received this e-mail but you think that you are not subject to the reporting obligation for 2016, you are requested to submit a NIL report, which will prevent the EEA from sending you reminders about your reporting obligations. How to submit a NIL report is also explained in the BDR manual available at: https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu/help/fgases.

Getting help

On the BDR F-gases help page at https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu/help/fgases you will find guidance on

  • How to submit your report in the BDR (BDR User Manual)
  • How to understand the reporting obligation (Frequently Asked Questions)

BDR Helpdesk

Please feel free to contact the BDR Helpdesk (BDR.helpdesk@eea.europa.eu) for technical assistance to the reporting process beyond the manuals provided on the BDR F-gases help page.

For any questions not related to the reporting process, please contact your competent national authority as listed on DG CLIMA s F-gas webpages: https://ec.europa.eu/clima/sites/clima/files/f-gas/docs/contact_list_en.pdf.

Thank you in advance for your co-operation.

Yours faithfully
BDR Helpdesk

fields.subject: WARNING - F-Gas reporting covering {year} due by {closing_date}
fields.body_html:
Dear {{CONTACT}},

This message is addressed to you as the contact person of an undertaking that by {closing_date} needed to report data on fluorinated greenhouse gases (F-Gases) under Article 19 of Regulation (EU) No 517/2014.

You receive this message because so far EEA has not received the report for {{COMPANY}} in {{COUNTRY}} despite our earlier requests and the fact that the deadline for the submission has passed on {closing_date}. Please report to the European Environment Agency (EEA) using the online Business Data Repository (BDR) at https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu. Further information is available on the BDR website (https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu/help/fgases).

We urge you to submit the report now without any further delay. We already informed the European Commission and the competent authority in your Member State about the delay. This might lead to an investigation regarding your potential non-compliance with Article 19 of Regulation (EU) No 517/2014. This may result into a fine.

In case you should have sent the report already before the evening of 6 April 2017, please contact us at bdr.helpdesk@eea.europa.eu to verify whether or not the report was actually received.

If you received this e-mail but you think that you are no longer subject to the reporting obligations, please be so kind to let us know by filling in a short online reporting form stating that you are not obliged to report for the year 2016 (NIL report). For this purpose, you will need to follow the procedures as described in the F-Gas BDR user manual (https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu/help/fgases).

Please note that we recently published translated versions of the F-gas BDR reporting manual in the following languages: Dutch, French, German, Greek, Italian, Polish and Spanish. The FAQ document was translated into following languages: French, German, Greek, Italian, Polish and Spanish. The material is available via: https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu/help/fgases

Disclaimer: The mailing list used for this reminder was last updated 6 April by end of business.

Thank you in advance for your co-operation.

Yours faithfully,
BDR Helpdesk

fields.subject: Reporting data on F-Gases covering {year} activities due by {closing_date}
fields.body_html:
Dear {{CONTACT}},

This message is addressed to you as the contact person of an undertaking that by {closing_date} may need to report data on fluorinated greenhouse gases (F-Gases) under Article 19 of Regulation (EU) No 517/2014.

You receive this invitation as your company is registered in the European Commission's F-gas Portal https://webgate.ec.europa.eu/ods2/ and your business profile as stated therein implies that you need to report.

The company for which you may need to report is {{COMPANY}} in {{COUNTRY}}, represented by {{REPNAME}} ({{REPVAT}}) in {{REPCOUNTRY}}. Please note that this message is addressed to all contact persons that are registered for this company.

How to submit your report?

For reporting please use your EU login account and password, which allows you to access the F-gas portal. You access the reporting platform either from within the F-gas portal by clicking on the orange "Reporting" link (top right corner) or by proceeding directly to the online Business Data Repository (BDR) at: https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu.

Detailed information on how to upload your delivery to BDR is available in the BDR user manual: https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu/help/fgases.

The BDR is now open for reporting on 2016 activties!

Reporting requirements

Reporting is obligatory for each

  • Producer, importer and exporter that produced, imported or exported one metric tonne or 100 tonnes of CO2 equivalent or more of F-gases (Annex I and/or Annex II). The reportable quantity of F-gases imported or exported covers bulk shipments, including F-gases shipped with equipment for the purpose of charging that equipment. Please note that imports and exports refer to imports into the EU and exports out of the EU. Shipments between EU Member States are not considered imports or exports and are thus not subject to reporting.
  • Company that destroyed 1 metric tonne or 1 000 tonnes of CO2 equivalent or more of F-gases.
  • Company that used 1 000 tonnes of CO2 equivalent or more of F-gases as feedstock.
  • Company that placed on the EU market 500 tonnes of CO2 equivalent or more of F-gases contained in imported products or equipment.
  • Company that authorised the use of HFC quota to another undertaking.

Please note that since 2015 the list of reportable F-gases was extended compared to previous years. Along with other technical guidance on how to understand the reporting obligation the reportable gases are listed in the updated Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) document available on: https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu/help/fgases. Translations of the FAQ in French, German, Italian, Polish and Spanish should be available by early March.

In case you did already submit a report in previous years; you may save time by using a prefilled webform. This includes the structural information from your latest submission of last year such as:

  • Company affiliations,
  • Selected activities,
  • Selected gases,
  • Trade partners,
  • Selected categories for imported products and equipment.

Please note that you still are able to change the previously reported information. Numeric information on reported amounts of gases will not be taken over from the past reports.

For producers and importers, the 31 December stocks as reported for the previous year will be imported as 01 January stocks for the present year. In case you make changes to the 01 January stocks, please provide a comment in order to explain the deviation in stocks with the 31 December stocks of the previous year. For more detailed information and guidance please consult the recently updated F-gas BDR User Manual available at: https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu/help/fgases.

If you received this e-mail but you think that you are not subject to the reporting obligation for 2016, you are requested to submit a NIL report, which will prevent the EEA from sending you reminders about your reporting obligations. How to submit a NIL report is also explained in the BDR manual available at: https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu/help/fgases.

Getting help

On the BDR F-gases help page at https://bdr.eionet.europa.eu/help/fgases you will find guidance on

  • How to submit your report in the BDR (BDR User Manual)
  • How to understand the reporting obligation (Frequently Asked Questions)

BDR Helpdesk

Please feel free to contact the BDR Helpdesk (BDR.helpdesk@eea.europa.eu) for technical assistance to the reporting process beyond the manuals provided on the BDR F-gases help page.

For any questions not related to the reporting process, please contact your competent national authority as listed on DG CLIMA s F-gas webpages: https://ec.europa.eu/clima/sites/clima/files/f-gas/docs/contact_list_en.pdf.

Thank you in advance for your co-operation.

Yours faithfully
BDR Helpdesk
